title: 107_hr316
content: The "Children's Education Tax Credit Act" allows for a credit for education expenses of students receiving or eligible to receive free or reduced price school meals under section 35 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Children's Education Tax Credit Act allows a tax credit for qualified education expenses paid by an individual for the education of a student who receives or is eligible to receive free or reduced price meals. The credit is limited to $1,500 per individual per taxable year. The term 'qualified education expenses' includes tuition, fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at an eligible educational institution. It does not cover expenses for meals, lodging, or personal living costs. The term 'qualified education expenses' covers tuition, fees, books, supplies, and equipment for courses at an eligible educational institution. For home schooling, it includes tutoring, books, supplies, computer equipment, and other necessary items. The term 'eligible educational institution' includes secondary schools, elementary schools, and private, parochial, religious, or home schools providing elementary or secondary education. The definition of 'elementary school' and 'secondary school' is based on the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. Qualified education expenses may be adjusted for scholarships received by an individual. The text discusses the application of subsection (b) for calculating taxable income based on qualified scholarships. It also mentions the Secretary's authority to create regulations for this section. Additionally, technical amendments are made to the Children's Education Tax Credit Act. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
